answers.answer: Thanks for responding to the question. What makes this Forum work is that people DO read and respond to queries and also to answers that are given. We can benefit from other people's experiences. I hope your son is doing well and that your apparent sanity is comforting to any moms of very young diabetic children out there who might be reading this.
Hi that is a terrible diagnosis, how are you dealing with that? Is he okay? I have been a diabetic for 30 years maybe I can help you.

My son was diagnosed at birth....actually they believe he was diabetic during my pregnancy because he was only 4 lbs 14 oz when he was born and I am a type I diabetic myself who should have larger babies! Thankfully he was diagnosed as a transient diabetic who would just need time to let his insulin producers mature and was taken off insulin at 6 mnths and "cured." He is at higher risk to redevelop.
